intro: Lotononis purpurescens, commonly known as the purple lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, purple-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant floral display.
